intro: Aria japonica f. calocarpa, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue, depending on the variety. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. The foliage and flowers are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
